intro: Rhodorhiza scoparia, commonly known as the desert broom. It is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa and the Middle East. The plant has small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the rainy season. Its leaves are small and often covered in a fine layer of hair to reduce water loss. Rhodorhiza scoparia is well adapted to harsh environments, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
